title: United Airlines logo font
content:
Can anyone tell me what the United Airlines font is? Example at \< [http://a56.g.akamai.net/7/56/7207/1726fc69ee7005/www.united.com/images/ual\_logo\_home.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073515/http:/a56.g.akamai.net/7/56/7207/1726fc69ee7005/www.united.com/images/ual_logo_home.gif)\>   
   
Thanks!
author: copperfont

comments.content: Most probably a [logotype,](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073515/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=1476339&page=38&brand_id=19454) not a font, especially looking at the T. But Futura Extra Bold is on the right track.
If you need more letters, check out \< [http://www.unitedairlines.de/press/images/logos.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073515/http:/www.unitedairlines.de/press/images/logos.html)\>

There are a lot of sans faces that are very close to this look. Even [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073515/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-95-black/testdrive.html?s=U+N+I+T+E+D&p=24) looks close.   
   
 - Lex

Based on your new post, I'd say it's Helvetica, but customised (the T and R stand out the most).   
   
 - Lex
Ted looks more like Akzidenz Grotesk than Futura to me, the angle at which the lowercase 'e' ends kinda gives it away.

The United logo is a modified version of Futura Bold. When   
United spun off Ted, they kept Futura Bold, but used U&lc.   
   
(TedEx anyone?)   
   
 [http://www.flyted.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073515/http:/www.flyted.com/)

Upon a second look, that e in Ted is not Futura. Or if it is,   
Pentagram modified that too.
